text.0: o indra drink this soma pressed out in the mortar full of sweets.
text.1: send down to us great richesat your glad carousein thousands o most healthy thou art waxing great.
text.2: to thee with sacrifices with oblations and with lauds we come.
text.3: lord of all strength and power grantat your glad carousethe best choiceworthy treasure thou art waxing great.
text.4: thou who art lord of precious boons inciter even of the churl.
text.5: guardian of singers indraat your glad carousesave us from woe and hatred thou art waxing great.
text.6: strong lords of magic power ye twain churned the united worlds apart.
text.7: when ye implored by vimada nāsatyas forced apart the pair.
text.8: when the united pair were rent asunder all the gods complained.
text.9: the gods to the nāsatyas cried bring these together once again.
text.10: sweet be my going forth and rich in sweets be my approach to home.
text.11: so through your deity both gods enrich us with all pleasantness.
